body: I've begun testing with LeakCanary, and this is the second leak to be reported to me from it. Keeping this here in case I get busy and someone else finds interest. I should have the first leak fix and the implementation pushed out in a bit. title: AlbumsGridFragment:52 leaks.

body:
Hi,

I have been trying to get around this problem but to no avail. I hope you can help me.
I have mopidy version 1.1.1 installed using the sqlite local library. In mpdroid I can see the artists, but the album tab remains empty.
When I look in mopidy's debug I see this happening:
  Request from [::ffff:192.168.179.26]:53762: list "album" "group" "artist"
DEBUG    2015-10-18 10:27:00,700 [22935:MpdSession-19] mopidy.mpd.session
  Response to [::ffff:192.168.179.26]:53762: ACK [2@0] {list} not able to parse args

Now, strangely, when I was using an older version of mopidy (0.19.x) when I was requesting the albums mpdroid would request list "album" only which worked fine. So it seems to me to be an issue on mpdroid's side, but on the other hand how can I be the only one affected?

Same happens if I use the json library by the way.

Thanks for any help!
title: Empty album list

body: In Android 5 notifications are divided Ingo sensitive notifications which can only be read fron an unlocked phone an unsensitive oned which also be read just by turning the screen on. Notifications are sensitive by default. It would be nice if you can make MPDroid notifications unsensitive.
title: Make notification unsensitive

body:
Hey. I use my own MPD server implementation and since the betas mpdroid behaves weird.

The following shows a communication log for:

* Start MPDroid
* Bring up the now playing thing
* Press the "random" icon: I get the random action and change my state, send "changed: options" back and respond to the following "status" command so MPDroid knows the new status.
* Now pressing "random" again, I send "changed: options" again, but MPDroid doesn't update its status anymore.
* After that, pressing again does not send "changed: options" as MPDroid doesn't change the random state on my side.

While It could be a bug on my side, I'd appreciate a look over the log if somethings stands out. The numbers starting each line are the connection IDs, so MPDroid has 3 open connections at all times here.

title: crash with beta on startup

body:
To fix #715 

It remains an issue (at least when the album cache is enabled) : the displayed album track number is not correct. It always displays 1.
The problem already exists in the develop branch.

I think it is related to the album cache. The listAllInfo method in MPD.java returns a wrong number of "Music". So the built cache is wrong.
It is just a guess since I do not know the code that well anymore.

@avuton, @abarisain : Do you know this problem ?
title: Remove artist under cover from artist library view

body:
When you look at the "Now-Playing"-window, you see in the right of the Album-Name the Year-tag. But when you turn your tablet/phone 90° the year-info disappears.
Is this wanted or a an issue?
title: Disappearing "Year"-Info in the "Now-Playing"-window

body:
Hi,
There is a lot of time I did not contribute to this great project ...
A lot of great things have been done. I keep on using MPDroid everyday and I really enjoy it. Thanks !

A feature I miss is a way to display song comments.
For me it is very useful with podcasts that contain a quick overview of the episode as comments.

Of course you need to setup your mpd server to read the comment tags.

I tried to add this feature without changing any existing behaviour :

In the album view :
- Tap the album header to toggle song comment display (an other tap restores the original display)
- Add the album year in the header

Some pictures to show the result.
- Before a tap on the album header:
![mpdroid-album-without-comments](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1272343/9704219/37e05bee-549e-11e5-9eae-fa7e988cf6d1.png)

-After a tap on the album header:
![mpdroid-album-with-comments](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1272343/9704226/5e14bc56-549e-11e5-9b69-5b0300f2eabf.png)

Thanks again for the great work !
title: Toggle Comment Display in the Album View

body:
Hi,

i am currently using 1.08 Beta 3. if i long tap on a search result, a context menue with various options appears. (Add to play list, etc.) if i select one of the options, the menue gets closed, but otherwise nothing happens.

Is there a more recent apk to check if that Problem still exists?
title: Long tap context menue does not work

body: It appears during the transition that the queue lost the ability to clear on large tablets (my Nexus 10). Probably lost a couple of other things from that drop down box.
title: The queue lost the clear feature.

body:
From reading old issues it seems that having multi-server support means rewritting a lot of code...
What about a workaround? Instead of having multi-server support, install 2 or 3 versions of mpdroid and configure each with different server. For this, we would need to have packaged mpdroid under few different names (mpdroid, mpdroid-2, mpdroid-3 for example) to be able to install it multiple times to the same device.

Then at least print the server name somewhere in the UI, so that we know which instance is currently active. Plus having differently colored icon in app drawer and in widget for each instance would be perfect.
title: Simple multi-server solution

body:
This is probably not a big issue for most users. But if you run mpd on laptop it probably change its address as you switch wifi networks. And often you can't use hostname since these cheap home routers usually don't resolve local names.

However according to this
http://developer.android.com/training/connect-devices-wirelessly/nsd.html#discover
it seems it shouldn't be that hard to implement discovery using dns-sd as zeroconf is already implemented in mpd.
title: Add support for service (mpd) discovery using avahi/dns-sd?

body:
I use MPDroid solely to control an mpd instance which streams audio for output on my android, never as a "remote control" for another mpd output.

Any time I stop playback or restart MPDroid the 'Streaming' checkbox gets unchecked. To check it again I first have to start playback - during which time I'm not getting any audio output obviously.

This makes for a really clunky user experience in my use case. Ideally it would stay checked until I manually uncheck it.

Really love this software otherwise. Thanks for your hard work!
title: Streaming checkbox does not stay checked

body:
It'd be great to have such a feature.
But I think this might not be possible to implement, because as afaik mpd doesn't allow clients to download the files.
title: Download audio files from server

body:
It would be nice to have the possibility to keep the screen on (e.g., when the music is playing and the app is in foreground). This would allow to dock the phone/tablet and build a very convenient to use docked remote. 

The screen can be kept on using other apps (e.g., tasker), but having the functionality directly in mpdroid would allow to specify finer grained conditions to control when the screen should not go off.
title: Add option to keep the screen on (e.g., when playing)
Help with local cover art please

title: Failed initial connection

body:
In Android 5, notifications are displayed on the lock screen, but the default is for their contents to be hidden. So all I'm seeing of the MPDroid notification is "MPDroid \n Contents hidden". Other media players allow their notifications to show their contents on the lock screen, so playback can be controlled without having to unlock the phone.

Without being an Android developer, if I understand [this article here](http://www.intertech.com/Blog/android-development-tutorial-lollipop-notifications/) correctly, it should be a one-liner along the lines of `notification.setVisibility(Notification.VISIBILITY_PUBLIC);`. I hope I'm correct and this is an easy fix. :)
title: Android 5: notification is not displayed on lock screen

body:
Hello, 
I am running Android 5.1.1 on a Nexus 5 device. I suppose the streaming function in the application is made to allow playback of audio tracks streamed; alas there is no actual sound during playback. 
I have a set up MPD server back home:

```
audio_output {
        type            "httpd"
        name            "My HTTP Stream"
        bind_to_address "10.0.1.5"
        encoder         "lame"       
        port            "6601"
        quality         "5.0"                 
        format          "44100:16:1"
        max_clients     "0"
```
The application successfully connects to the server, queues the song and starts playback. I can see time ongoing during playback.
The server log has no errors, sample log since server start:
```
$ tail -f /var/log/mpd/mpd.log
Jun 04 19:35 : avahi: Service 'Music Player' successfully established.
Jun 04 19:44 : player_thread: played "01.02_High/Dafu – I choose you.mp3"
Jun 04 19:52 : player_thread: played "100-1_-_night_shift/Joan Reyes - Shakedown (Bass Kelph Remix).mp3"
Jun 04 22:14 : player_thread: played "01.02_High/Dafu – I choose you.mp3"
```
Finally, I can successfully get sound in other MPD clients.

How to reproduce:
Open MPDroid; Select artist - select song. Scroll up playback screen. From alternative menu select "Streaming".

Is that me doing something wrong, or the app is not intended for audio playback as it's secondary function?
Thank you.
title: No sound during streaming

body:
Hi there,

I am using MPDroid together with Mopidy. I changed two rather small things with the way mopidy and MPDroid interact when searching that in my opinion greatly improve user experience:
 - Mopidy includes Albums and Artists as explicit items in search results. Therefore album and artist results are listed in song results as well (prefaced by "Album: " and "Artist:". They are now filtered out by checking the beginning of the filename: If it begins with "spotify:album" or "spotify:artist", it is not included in the track list. (One could make this configurable, but i cannot think of any use case where you would want to display them)
 - When searching, there are just so many search results that ordering them alphabetically makes the relevant results disappear in all the noise. Fortunately, they already come ordered by relevancy. Therefore I added an option to disable sorting of search results.

Cheers,
Jakob
title: Better Search behaviour when using mopidy

I have MPDroid 1.07.2 (54) installed on my phone. My music collection contains several albums spanning more than 10 discs (books read and recorded).

When I add one such album to the playlist it will order the tracks as follows:
- All tracks from disc 1 (in proper disc order)
- All tracks from disc 10 (in proper disc order)
- All tracks from disc 11 (in proper disc order)
- All tracks from disc 2 (in proper disc order)
- All tracks from disc 3 (in proper disc order)
...

So discs 10 and 11 are sorted after disc 1 and before disc 2. It looks like the sorting algorithm is sorting string based instead of number based (the string "10" would sort before the string "2").
title: Album with more than 10 discs will be added in wrong order to playlist

Hi,
first of all thanks for this great app!
I'm trying to use the tasker plugin to drive my morning alarm clock, and gently rise the volume, but currently your implementation doesn't let you set the volume based on a variable, so I can't use it in a loop (and adding something like 70 actions to only change the volume is not the way programming should work :) )

Can you please add tasker variables support?

Thanks for the attention!

body:
**UPDATE : MPDroid stays, thanks ! Please check my final answer**

Hi,

Today, MPDroid got threatened of removal by Google.  
I tried to appeal, but it got denied and MPDroid will probably be removed from the Play Store soon(ish).  

![Appeal email](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/312529/5254168/852106ea-79ae-11e4-918b-e762520ca87b.png)

Since it's still on the store, I pushed 1.07 Final. It's a release that I'm proud of, because it's the first stable release in a year. I want to use this space to say *thank you* to all contributors. Especially to @avuton , who has been doing a crazy work inside JMPDComm.  

Anyway, 1.07 Final contains a small nag (only shown once), to warn Play Store users of what is happening.

![Nag 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/312529/5254064/a15ace5a-79ad-11e4-8da1-c9173dd2318c.png)
![Nag2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/312529/5254066/a2d5e1ac-79ad-11e4-806f-d498d38fad8d.png)

I also reached out to F-Droid to try to get 1.07 updated there too. APKs are still downloadable here, and the project will remain open source. It's something I strongly believe in, even more tonight. 

I'm still unsure about what the next steps are for us, or where the project will go. We barely released new versions, so after all it does not change much.

If you are curious, I've written a post about this : http://nlss.fr/mpdroid/

Thanks for reading!
title: [Important Announcement] MPDroid about to be pulled from Play Store

body:
"Use Album Cache"is turned on in Library settings.
A new album is added to the server and the update button pressed.
Pressing on an artist results in the expected (30 second-ish) delay as the server db is refetched.
However, if I click on another artist there is again a delay / network activity as if the data is being fetched again (as if the local cache is not being queried).  Clicking on a third artist also results in delay / network activity etc etc.

When the artist page finally appears after the refetch it contains duplicate blank albums with (null) as the tag data (see screenshot):
![screenshot_2014-11-03-22-31-15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6242588/4891901/9a34e91a-63ac-11e4-82f5-eedebb22466b.png)

If I kill mpdroid and manually delete the local cache things return to normal but subsequently  pressing the update button starts the issue again.
title: [1.07 c810be0-c] Local cache update issue.

body:
I'm not sure if I understand correctly, but judging from the default settings, it is possible to have your tablet play back the stream from `mpd` through an `icecast2` server, right?

I already have this set up. I control `mpd` through `MPDroid` on my main amp when listening to music. When I'm in my home-office (same LAN), I listen to music on my laptop from the following address:

```
http://192.168.2.1:64800/mpd.ogg
```

But when I enter these settings in `MPDroid`, I hear nothing:

Streaming host: `192.168.2.1` (also tried `http://192.168.2.1`)
Streaming port: `64800`
Streaming URL suffix: `mpd.ogg` (also tried `/mpd.ogg`, `mpd.ogg.m3u` )

The output does show up, and when I uncheck it, the playback on the laptop stops.

I am not sure if this is an issue with MPDroid as I might as well be doing something wrong. But it kinda seems like I'm doing it right. :smile: 

---

Android `4.4.2` on Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.2

---

`mpd.conf`

```
audio_output {
        type            "alsa"
        name            "Redsandro ALSA MPD"
}
audio_output {
        type            "shout"
        name            "Redsandro icecast2"
        host            "localhost"
        port            "64800"
        mount           "mpd.ogg"
        password        "****************"
        bitrate         "192"
        format          "44100:16:2"
        public          "no"
        encoding        "mp3"
}
```
title: MPDroid does not play back my stream

Hi there ! I'm updating MPDroid with a quick Material touch so that we're ready for L.  

One thing I noticed is that once again, Pull To Refresh is bugged. The style is wrong (fixable, but annoying to fix), the hitbox is too big and prevents the use of the Fast Scroll, and it does not look that good.  

I have to admit that adding pull to refresh is a UX failure (and implementation failure) for MPDroid. 
Here is what I suggest :
 - Remove it
 - Remove it and add a refresh button
 - Replace it by Google's pull to refresh _Which, in my opinion, sucks ass_
 - ?

What do you guys think ?
title: [Discussion] Pull to refresh

I've implemented supported for song ratings, 0 to 10, displayed as 5 stars with 1/2 star resolution.

The code is rather rough as I've written hardly any Java in the last 10 years and I really don't have much of an idea about Android development (frameworks and tooling). Also, I don't know how to keep IntelliJ from trampling over the existing module definitions.

As far as I know, currently only [Cantata](https://code.google.com/p/cantata/) supports ratings. However, as indicated by https://code.google.com/p/cantata/issues/detail?id=555 , may re-introduce them.

Please let me know if you're willing in general to support ratings in MPDroid and in what way I ought to change the relevant code.
title: Support for song ratings

body:
Hello there,
some time ago a opened a VERY long and headache causing thread with the same topic. I hope you have already forgotten it... :-)

Now everything seems clearer and can be brought down to a simple question:
Why does MPDroid double the entries for albums with multi-artist-tags?

For example:
I got 3 albums with "Hans Theessink" as artist and every one of these 3 albums has a different second artist. When i telnet the following phrase to MPD

list album artist "Hans Theessink"

it gives me the 3 correct albums.

But when i search in MPDroid in the specific genre for "Hans Theessink", i get the albums doubled - i have 6 results, 2 for every album (incl. coverart). One of these doubled entries points to the correct album and the other one points to nirvana.

So, do you know what's the reason for this behaviour? And is it possible to change that?
title: Strange behaviour for tracks with multi-artist-tags

body:
MPDPlaylist.refresh() and others that are associated with it need to have potential race conditions minimized and should probably be refactored. I think the following exemption is probably not a regression. I think it is a very unlucky/uncommon race, with a smaller possibility of being some other bug in this method.

Associated with [Crashlytics Bug #8](http://crashes.to/s/dd46f33b673).

```
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
       at java.util.AbstractList.subList(AbstractList.java:738)
       at java.util.Collections$SynchronizedRandomAccessList.subList(Collections.java:483)
       at org.a0z.mpd.MusicList.subList(MusicList.java:190)
       at org.a0z.mpd.MPDPlaylist.refresh(MPDPlaylist.java:333)
       at org.a0z.mpd.MPDPlaylist.playlistChanged(MPDPlaylist.java:283)
       at org.a0z.mpd.MPDStatusMonitor.run(MPDStatusMonitor.java:177)
```
title: MPDPlaylist has concurrency issues.

body:
OK, with this diff:

```
--- a/MPDroid/src/com/namelessdev/mpdroid/helpers/MPDAsyncHelper.java
+++ b/MPDroid/src/com/namelessdev/mpdroid/helpers/MPDAsyncHelper.java
@@ -69,6 +69,8 @@ public class MPDAsyncHelper extends Handler {
 
         @Override
         public void connectionStateChanged(boolean connected, boolean connectionLost) {
+            Log.e(TAG, "MPDAsyncHelper().connectionStateChanged("+connected+", "+connectionLost+")");
+
             MPDAsyncHelper.this.obtainMessage(EVENT_CONNECTIONSTATE,
                     Tools.toObjectArray(connected, connectionLost)).sendToTarget();
         }
```

If MPDroid is put into airplane mode while playing the output to logcat will be something like:

```
07-15 13:38:37.656  22407-22430/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/MPDAsyncHelper﹕ MPDAsyncHelper().connectionStateChanged(true, false)
<Airplane mode enabled here>
07-15 13:38:54.976  22407-22430/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/MPDAsyncHelper﹕ MPDAsyncHelper().connectionStateChanged(true, true)
07-15 13:38:56.996  22407-22430/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/MPDAsyncHelper﹕ MPDAsyncHelper().connectionStateChanged(true, true)
<SNIP wild exception here>
07-15 13:38:59.016  22407-22430/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/MPDAsyncHelper﹕ MPDAsyncHelper().connectionStateChanged(false, true)
```

This doesn't seem like expected behaviour to me. If the connection is lost, we're in a disconnected state (does this mean something else? I was expecting it to be like this:
```
07-15 13:46:09.401  22658-22678/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/MPDAsyncHelper﹕ MPDAsyncHelper().connectionStateChanged(true, false)
07-15 13:46:21.056  22658-22678/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/MPDAsyncHelper﹕ MPDAsyncHelper().connectionStateChanged(false, true)
```
And it all leads back to [MPD.java:1149](https://github.com/abarisain/dmix/blob/master/JMPDComm/src/org/a0z/mpd/MPD.java#L1149).

So I made this test patch:
```
diff --git a/JMPDComm/src/org/a0z/mpd/MPD.java b/JMPDComm/src/org/a0z/mpd/MPD.java
index d521f87..561a020 100644
--- a/JMPDComm/src/org/a0z/mpd/MPD.java
+++ b/JMPDComm/src/org/a0z/mpd/MPD.java
@@ -1148,7 +1148,7 @@ public class MPD {
      */
     public boolean isConnected() {
         return mpdIdleConnection != null && mpdStatusConnection != null && mpdConnection != null
-                && mpdIdleConnection.isConnected();
+                && mpdIdleConnection.innerIsConnected();
     }
 
     public boolean isMpdConnectionNull() {
```

Alas, my fix is incorrect (causes strange behaviour elsewhere :/). Ideas?
title: connectionStateChanged() unexpected behaviour

body:
This is the large merge that I've been talking about. I know of no outstanding regressions at this moment, so (IMHO) it's time to get it out there. There are a few hard steps to take for this code after this, but I believe they will not be nearly this size.

This does fix a few bugs found along the way, but this was mostly a compartmentalization cleanup. This also adds incremental updating of the various services the old NotificationService had, rather than the one big update. If I had to, I'd call it services v3.

Outside of the above mentioned, there are a couple of small patches for:
* Server activity detection & handling. I don't like the solution that this PR brings (which the API is extremely limited for) but it's light years ahead of the old method and robust enough to do what needs to be done for the time being. I have every intention of a large improvement when it comes to this, but I probably have a couple of PRs before the code is where it needs to be for that improvement.

* A couple of helper methods to deal with no cover art resources.
title: Service compartmentalization and incremental updating.

body:
Not every time, but _"too damn often"_ when I switch back to __MPDroid__ `1.06` on my _Samsung Galaxy Note Pro_ with KitKat Android `4.4.2` from another app, I get the following message:

_Connection to MPD-Server failed! Check if the Server is running and reachable. (Connection Lost)_

Well, this is on my LAN and the server is very much running and reachable. When I touch "retry", the problem is fixed immediately.

Hence, I think the moment where Android switches back to _MPDroid_ and unhibernates the app (or however this works), _MPDroid_ is too impatient and decides the connection is lost before it even had a chance to check this out for real.

If MPDroid would be more patient, or would silently try again 100 milliseconds later before actually throwing this message to the user, I - and I estimate certain other users - would never (have to) see this message.

Problem fixed. :smile: 

![Connection Failed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1702193/3174841/a8b23648-ebf5-11e3-887b-d1ea78d29a7d.png)
title: Fake "Connection Failed" messages all the time.

body:
As promised, here's a shorter PR. One of the reasons I did such long PRs before was to take more time to test, then more code would come and it appeared to be a vicious cycle :smile: 

* TrackInfoUpdateAsync: Moved to it's own class, cleaned up, added a callback. It's pretty specific to the NowPlaying*Fragments at the moment, I have further plans in mind.

* MPDControl: A class to unify simple (threaded) command sending. This breaks out what was in NotificationService and extends it a bit, which allowed for a sizable cleanup.

* MPDStatus/MixRamp fixes.

* Fix the status bar failing to update (bug from last PR).

* Tons of cleanups.
title: TrackInfoUpdateAsync cleanup, threaded control cleanup, other various cleanups and bugfixes.

body:
Wow, writing the title, I'm starting to realize there's a ton of stuff here, the title didn't do it all justice. Anyhow, seems stable enough here to the point that I need to get this "out there" for testing.

I did rewrite some newly written code (as we discussed) simply for cleanliness. I dropped the streaming patches (due to the new StreamFragment stuff) and I've pushed some of the patches we discussed until later.

The NowPlaying*Fragment stuff should be really good (I hope). No more seekbar jumping around when seeking (I /hope/), or at least less of it, it's been cleaned up and is now dynamic.

Persistent notification stuff has been around for some time, but I didn't get serious about it until @DrVanScott drowned me with issues with notifications in general. The persistent notification patch is actually quite a refactoring of notification support (1.1? ;)) rather than just persistent notification support.

The app singleton allowed a huge cleanup and, while I got a lot of it, I'm sure there are odds and ends from here.

Warning fixes, JMPDComm reformatting (oy did it need it),  Music / MPDStatistics / Miscellaneous refactoring, tons of possible (unfound?) bug fixes, StreamingService possible crash fix under bad conditions... and more things I'm sure I forgot already.

I'll try to push more early and often. I get started... and it's hard to stop. Taking time off to review patches is boring (why most devs don't even do it!), but I don't want to PR prior to that and I let this party carry on a little too long (sorry!).
title: Warning fixes, NowPlaying*Fragment cleanups, Persistent Notification, Precompiled Patterns, App singleton...

body:
Getting this often when I browse the FS fragment. I can confirm it's coming from [MPD.java](https://github.com/abarisain/dmix/blob/master/JMPDComm/src/org/a0z/mpd/MPD.java#L955). This is abarisain/master@d780944.

05-05 14:42:51.904  14181-14211/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/MpdCallable﹕ MPD command listplaylistinfo failed after 3 attempts : ACK [50@0] {listplaylistinfo} No such playlist
title: Constant StreamsFragment/listplaylistinfo warning when browsing fragment.

body:
I got this twice during exit; this is from my branch, but I haven't edited any of the StreamsFragment stuff:
```
05-05 14:25:20.248  12303-12319/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/Streams﹕ Error while loading streams

```
title: NPE@StreamsFragment.java:288

body:

title: Disconnect after Add, Replace & Play

body:
MPD finally added a very great function : list grouping http://git.musicpd.org/cgit/master/mpd.git/diff/doc/protocol.xml?id=ae178c77bdc47c954fd9a4b32ffc07fe6c4a8a49   (commit : http://git.musicpd.org/cgit/master/mpd.git/commit/?id=ae178c77bdc47c954fd9a4b32ffc07fe6c4a8a49 )

This allows us to have a great album list, just like the cache provides us. 

Sadly, we can't limit MPDroid to latest version clients so we need to have a fallback.
title: Implement album list grouping

body:
Let me preface by saying I took the time to bisect this problem down to find out it's a problem against MPD's git version (0.19~git). That's not to say it's not a bug with us as well, but if we want to go ahead and close this I'm perfectly fine with that; this is here for future reference, if necessary.

* library cache must be off. I've seen it work sometimes with it on (when that doesn't fail for me).

Here's what happens:
* I go to Library/Artists
* I go to Artist Blur (this only shows with MPD-0.19~git, with MPD-0.18.10 it doesn't show at all, which is, I'm guessing, why it's not obvious that this is a problem).
* I have one song by Blur 'Song 2'
* Get a default information screen that says 'Various artists' 0 Tracks, 00:00 and 'No Results'

Here is the song information straight out of the database, I'm FAR too lazy to actually get the information from the protocol ;) Seriously, if you need something from me here, just let me know the commands I need to issue.

```
song_begin: Blur - Song 2.flac
Time: 122
Track: 2
Title: Song 2
MUSICBRAINZ_TRACKID: b39b7227-c271-4ab8-912b-cb1fe2fc0e5e
MUSICBRAINZ_ARTISTID: ba853904-ae25-4ebb-89d6-c44cfbd71bd2
MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMID: 086ee046-31ba-4b68-9a8a-2433971fd94f
MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMARTISTID: ba853904-ae25-4ebb-89d6-c44cfbd71bd2
Date: 2000-10-30
Artist: Blur
Album: Blur: The Best Of
mtime: 1173640600
song_end
```

Metaflac results of the actual file:
```
TRACKTOTAL=18
TRACKNUMBER=2
TITLE=Song 2
RELEASECOUNTRY=GB
MUSICIP_PUID=61516578-f76b-a483-859a-3a2bc7ce04c8
MUSICBRAINZ_VARIOUSARTISTS=0
MUSICBRAINZ_TRACKID=b39b7227-c271-4ab8-912b-cb1fe2fc0e5e
MUSICBRAINZ_SORTNAME=Blur
MUSICBRAINZ_NONALBUM=0
MUSICBRAINZ_ARTISTID=ba853904-ae25-4ebb-89d6-c44cfbd71bd2
MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMTYPE=compilation
MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMSTATUS=official
MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMID=086ee046-31ba-4b68-9a8a-2433971fd94f
MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMARTISTSORTNAME=Blur
MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMARTISTID=ba853904-ae25-4ebb-89d6-c44cfbd71bd2
MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMARTIST=Blur
DATE=2000-10-30
ARTIST=Blur
ALBUM=Blur: The Best Of
```

The first commit this occurs in is: 68121a0ef6f4a6f93025b92cdb4a4657846723be
title: Failures with some artists in Library/Album

body: Mm3u playlists placed somewhere in the directory served by MPD don't show up in MPDroid. note: MPD serves them well and they are perfectly handled by Linix clients.
title: Playlists is empty in MPDroid while entries are shown in other clients

body:
I have 5 user accounts. I don't have actively enabled the lock screen widget of mpdroid for any user.

One of the user accounts (A) is used to use mpdroid. mpdroid is only installed and configured for that user account. 

Using account A i start playback. Then i log out from that account. The lock screen of (A) does not show the mpdroid widget, just as intended. One of the other accounts will show the mpdroid-widget as soon as i select it, but currently it is not clear to me, which one. It seems random, but it may not. 

Why does the mpdroid lock screen widget show up for accounts that do not have mpdroid installed?

Why does the mpdroid lock screen widget show up at all? Doesn't it require to be actively activated (added) by the individual users?
title: Nexus 10: lock screen widget is shown for uninvolved / only some users

body:
Well, I took your initial recommendation and ran with it. I implemented some very minimalist and lazy audio focus code for the NotificationService. I think it's pretty good, and I also take into consideration the remote MPD user vs. the local user. Also, fixed the StreamingService focus as well.

With all that said, even though I like my code, if you have a different vision, I'm not amazingly committed to those commits.

With all that said, if you haven't seen the email yet, I also fixed #517. If you don't like the prior commits, feel free to cherry-pick the #517 commit.
title: Fixes

body:
For handling compilation-albums i have to let MPDroid look for "albumartist" instead of "artist". But when i use mixed (split) albumartists like "Clapton\\B.B. King" the thing does not work out ok:
First i choose genre "Blues", then i choose (album)artist "Clapton" which shows me the albums of Mr. Clapton. BUT all albums, which have a second albumartist (like "Clapton\\King") are doubled!
Alltogether i have 6 albums with Clapton as (album)artist, where 3 of them have a second (album)artist. The output now for "Clapton" is not 6 albums, like it should be, but 9 albums.

And strange enough: when i switch back to artist-search (instead of albumartist-search) the behaviour is the same. And still the same, when i search directly under artists, not genre.

The query to the library has to be something like:
list album albumartist "Clapton"
When prompted this directly in telnet, it gives me the correct 6 albums. Nothing doubled. So it seems, MPDroid mix up something here?!
title: MPDroid beta mix up entries for mixed "albumartist"

body:
This branch started off a clean up of StreamingService, then it turned into NotificationService cleanup. Some might consider these rewrites, to others this might be reorganization. At any rate, everything's working the way I think it should with exception of NotificationService, which I need to tweak and I plan to send a PR for in about a week to a month, depending on how this PR goes.

With all that said, there's a lot here. Is it buggy? Probably (though I don't know of any hard bugs at the moment). Expect fixes, especially if I find something prior to the PR pull (assuming this PR gets pulled, sooner or later). I need to get this "out there" for feedback and honestly the queue is quite large at this point.

Also tons of logs for now. Once things cool down a bit I'll send a commit to eliminate the vast majority of them.

Also, I'm not committed to 4dae8f6; it's more a feeler, something I think is good, but will drop it quickly at request

Let me know what you think, don't flame me too hard.
title: Streaming and Notification Service.

body:
Albums with more than one "Artist" behave very well in MPDroid - they appear under the different artists as they should. 
But when i use more than one "Album-Artist" the behaviour gets strange when the specific tag for the artists-listing in the menu is chosen:
The album with the (for example) 2 album-artists is showed for both of the artists as ist should, but not once but twice. One time for each artist, but under the wrong artist.
An example:
I have an album with Eric Clapton and B.B. King as 2 "Album Artist". When i now choose Eric Clapton in the library, there are 2 similar albums.
When i change the specific tag for the artists-listing in the menu from "Album Artist" to "Artist", the behaviour is the same (I have the same value for "artist" and "album artist").
But when i eliminate the "album artist"-tag in the tracks, the behaviour is normal again.
title: Problem with MPDroid-beta and multi-album-artists

body:
When the option "Album-Cache" in the library-settings-menu is activated, albums with more than one artist are not recognized any more.
Example: I have 5 albums with Eric Clapton as "artist" and one album with Eric Clapton and B.B. King as "artist". Normally this album with 2 artists is listed under Clapton and B.B. King but when "Album-Cache" is activated, this album is not listed any more under no Artist.
And even worse:
When "Album-Chache" is deactivated afterwards, all albums disappear from the library. The only way to fix this problem is to deinstall and install MPDroid again...
title: Severe bug in MPDroid-beta with "Album-Cache"

body:
When I was working around NotificationService when I got an NPE in an area unrelated to my work:

```
03-18 16:04:12.181  15492-15559/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/AndroidRuntime﹕ FATAL EXCEPTION: MPDAsyncWorker
    Process: com.namelessdev.mpdroid, PID: 15492
    java.lang.NullPointerException
            at com.namelessdev.mpdroid.fragments.ArtistsFragment.asyncUpdate(ArtistsFragment.java:70)
            at com.namelessdev.mpdroid.fragments.BrowseFragment$5.run(BrowseFragment.java:445)
            at com.namelessdev.mpdroid.helpers.MPDAsyncHelper$MPDAsyncWorker.handleMessage(MPDAsyncHelper.java:120)
            at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
            at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:136)
            at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:61)
```

That [boils down](https://github.com/abarisain/dmix/blob/master/MPDroid/src/com/namelessdev/mpdroid/fragments/ArtistsFragment.java#L70) to:
```final SharedPreferences settings = PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(getActivity().getApplication());```

So, I'm guessing, it's saying that ```getActivity()``` or the ```getApplication()``` returned ```null```? Which, I guess, kinda makes me wonder why we don't use the [```app```](https://github.com/abarisain/dmix/blob/master/MPDroid/src/com/namelessdev/mpdroid/fragments/BrowseFragment.java#L72) that was already resolved.
title: NPE at ArtistsFragment.java:70

body:
Hi,

cover arts can be fetched from a http server running on the same host like mpd. It would be great if the address of the http server could be different from the mpd server.
Example for the use case:
* You have a NAS that exports the music folder with NFS/CIFS and http.
* Another device (e.g. a Raspberry Pi) mounts the NAS folder and acts as mpd server.
title: Make server address for local cover arts configurable

body:
It's just an idea, and i'm quite sure it is too difficult to realize... But maybe you are interested? :-)

When i use MPDroid, i am always changing between the library-screen and the playlist-screen. And to my opinion its not very convenient to slide in the sidebar to choose the desired screen. It would much prefere to have both screens simultaneously and slide between the whole screens. Like it is, for example, realized with the playlist-screen and now-listening-screen in the phone-view.

title: Usability issue...

body:
Basically the WLAN-connection of my tablet (Nexus 10) which houses MPDroid works very well. But sometimes, when i wake up the tablet to get back to MPD (when the playlist is finished...), i get the message, that the WLAN-connection is not working properly and i can retry, cancel or ignore it. When i immediately retry, everything works perfectly again. This happens about every 5th time, when i wake up the tablet.

Is there maybe a possibility to let MPDroid wait for half a second or something like that, when the connection is not working instantly? Or is it a Android-problem which MPDroid cannot influence?
title: Little trouble with WLAN

body:
Android OS: 4.4.2 (Stock or very close)
Bisected to build: 68d146e
Video screencast of bug: http://youtu.be/lj1f4-HyQ6E
Bug: Fast scroll has a big jump at top of list in many of the list display fragments.

I have confirmed this bug affects the following fragments: Artists, Albums, Genres
I have confirmed this bug does not affect the following fragments: Songs, FS, AlbumsGrid

The others I haven't confirmed because they don't appear to be applicable or I don't have a list long enough to confirm.

The video I posted begins with the FS fragment and showing that scrolling the top of the list is not jumpy. Then I fumble until I get to the Artist fragment where I show scrolling top of the list has one big jump, though I've seen two big jumps happen as well.

The build this bisected to was discussed in #294, doesn't seem like the bisect commit is the root cause.

Wild speculation is that the bug is somehow related to the ArrayIndexerAdapter() since the *confirmed not affected* never appear to call that class.
title: [e0944e6] Fast scroll has a big jump at the top of many of the list display fragments

body:
Hi!
I just noticed another issue concerning the "Sort albums by year flag".
I have some various artists albums where the tracks are tagged like this:
Album artist = "Various"

Artist = the individual song artist
Track = Track no. on album
Title = Song title
Year = year of song, not of album
Now Mpdroid happens to sort the tracks in the view of the individual album not by tracknumber but by the year of the songs. Is that the intended way how it should work? I thought the flag was only supposed to change the sort order of the albums, not the tracks.

Btw, many thanks for keeping up the good work on this great piece of software!!!

body:
Hi,

Here's a feature that I found to be missing in the app when I downloaded it from the Play Store.

It's basically just a notification (incl. rich notification when pulling with two fingers) and a remote client (e.g. lockscreen widget) that allow to quickly:
- review current played item (artwork / artist / album / title)
- control MPD (prev/next/play-pause/stop)

It's currently:
- not 100% functional (there are some cases where the notification/remote client aren't displayed while MPD _is_ playing)
- not 100% tested: only used with my development device, which is a Nexus 5
- not 100% final: there are quite some debug logging made through the logcat

These numbers, while not being 100%, are quite close to it.

I might test on 4.0 emu or Nexus 7.

It is based off of my gradle branch, because I use Android Studio and gradle to build the app. I don't know git/github enough to submit a clean set of commits that only contain the notification/remote client features. I hope ant/eclipse users will be able to merge this in order to test! (see #402)
title: Notification and remote client

body:
Hi

He's a small submit to remove the volume bar when MPD server returns -1 on call to get volume. This indicates that the output device does not have a volume control, for instance optical output. The volume bar in this instances is useless to the user and performs not function and is slightly confusing to the user. Therefore we can detect this condition from the getVolume() and hide and disable the UI volume control.

Note: I've not tested with a MPD server that the output does support control of volume on the output device.


Phil 

some of the white space got changed in the process, I'm not sure how or why, but have corrected most that I can see
title: Volume bar remove when MPD get volume returns -1 (no volume control)

body:
There is an extra newline character appended to each command list request. This sends an erroneous empty MPD request after the command list but the "ACK [5@0] {} No command given" response is not read back from the server.

This becomes a noticeable problem when you do back-to-back command list requests. After n requests (where n is the number of command connection threads) the next request reuses a thread that's got an error response already waiting, so it will return this error rather than the expected response.  

The command list request seems to be re-issued and does eventually work, albeit slower than necessary. Except in the case of mopidy where it incorrectly returns "OK" for an empty command (a bug) so MPDroid doesn't re-request and the response is lost.
title: Extra newline after command list causes MPD 'No command given' error

Does it really make sense to have these classes?
I think it only adds confusion, as empty Strings and undefined Items are handled just the same by MPD(?) So it could just be an Artist or Album with "" name.
The storage saving by using the same class instance is not really worth it I think.

2nd (related) problem: If you have files where nothing is tagged, they should show up somewhere in the album/artist browser, as they do in gpmc, maybe with their filename.
(WAV or MPG files can't be tagged, but played by MPD for example)

The Unknown/empty artist/album should be an empty entry on top of the list like in gmpc.

Maybe the Strings in Music.java should also not be null as default but "".
The requests to MPD with a null artist are handled as "arbitrary artist" not the undefined artist. This makes the confusion.

body:
Some people have multiple MPD servers in different locations, they may even have to connect through a tunnel. This would be better managed through profiles, maybe auto detect which we can connect to and to not leak any information - let that profile have the wifi AP-name in it's settings. (Profile, not tied to the AP, but rather the AP is just a variable to configure within the profile)

My preposal is for the menu to have the profiles listed so you can change which you're talking to. Hold and reconfigure that profile.

Without these profiles, it becomes annoying to change the host ip while on the same WiFi AP just to talk to another computer. Personally, I use MPD to control my volume on my computers and maybe one day, TV. :P

Loving this app, a friend said it looks too plain but I love this minimalistic feel. Maybe let the user set the colours for different things? Be even better if those colourschemes were per-profile settable. I.e. Blue for home, Green for work and Red for tunnel to home from work. :P
title: Configuration suggestion - manage with profiles, not per wifi.

body:
This isssue was solved in the Beta 6 version, but came back in Beta 7.

If the path and song files doesn't contain special caracters, it's fine.
In other cases, Mpdroid sends bad requests to the Http server.

My test:
1) If select "Download local covers" (Télécharger les pochettes locales")
2) If define "mpdroid.jpg" as "cover name" (Nom du fichier pochette)
3) I test with a specific song: 
Folder: Zù
Cover file: folder.jpg
Song file: delà.flac

I logged the flows sent to the HTTP server with Wireshark.
73 tries are done, without success, because special caracters are transmitted in the form : \\371 in place of "ù" and \\340 in place of "à".
The good requests would have been:
GET /Zù/folder.jpg
or GET /Z%C3%B9/folder.jpg
or GET /Zù/delà.jpg
or GET /Z%C3%B9/del%C3%A0.jpg

If the "Album cover art listing in library" setting is unchecked, the general Album list shows progressbars forever, since the covers are not downloaded. The progressbars should either be hidden or download triggered (I think the latter is the best)


By the way, I believe that this option should now be the default and re-purposed to something like "Use grid view listing in library".  
I also find the big progressbars on the gridview a little annoying. They give you a clue that something is happening, which is great, but when covers are fetched from the cache, they don't even stay onscreen for half a second.  
The problem is that you can't really know that a cover is fetched from the cache or being downloaded (maybe a "downloadStarted" callback :/).  
Making the progressbars smaller on the cards is also a possibility.

body:
Some refactoring for the cover API :
- All the methods now use an AlbumInfo instead of strings
- The objects from MPD (Album, Aritst) provide this AlbumInfo object
- The Playlist data model was made of strings making it hard to plug into this object model. I refactored it to use an object model (ListAdapter with Music ...). I hope this will make future modifications safer.
- The stream URL is now always displayed in the playlist (on the second line) to know the radio you  are listening to even if the tag changed during the play.
- Use the Android Textutils to get rid of custom methods for nothing (I didn't know this class)
- Add progress bars when you change the cover (album view ...)
- Update the nowplaying view when you change cover from the library view


I did not push this because the refactoring on the playlist is kind of big.I wanted to know if abarisain is OK with it. I tested it and it seems to work nicely. I think it will made future modifications easier  (easy to make a mistake on a string name ...)
title: Refactor cover api & Playlist model

body:
Try to manage several threads to retrieve covers. This way we can enable it in the playlist view, even with big playlists.
I think there are plenty of room for improvements but it works well on my device (Nexus 7).
The web fetching from the playlist view is only done if the  enableAlbumArtLibrary property is enabled (a little hack to test it safely).

The main thing is a blocking queue where cover requests are added. Then several threads process the requests : 
- 2 for web requests ( 50 requests max are processed, others will be discarded, may need tuning ?)
- 1 for priority requests (playing now)
- 1 for the cache and bitmap making

I guess we may change these settings (too many thread ?)  if needed afte som tests.
I got some problems with bitmap recycling but it seems to work fine now

I clearly need some feedback to know how it performs on different hardwares.

Let me know what you think.
title: Multithreaded Cover Management

body:
Hi, I like mpdroid very much, yet would like to make a few UI comments and suggestions to make it more intuitive:

1. I find the function of the Home/now playing button next to the List Header (Artists, Albums etc.) very counter-intuitive. I always tap there to go back/up in hierarchy and end up cursing. I know that the android back button does what I want to, but somehow I can't get used to it, plus mine is positioned poorly, like on most phones.
At least the List header itself should have a long-tap context-menu attached to it, so you can choose to add the whole list (Album or Genre) or go back up. To be taken home here is especially annoying because of (2) the scroll position will not be retained once you go back home.

2. I second that the SCROLL POSITION of any list (Artists, Albums, Genres, ...) should be remembered.  It is awful to have to start with 'A' once you made your way down to 'T' while browsing for the whatyoumaycallits and clicking the home button unvoluntarily.

3. Should be easy:  The now-playing-footer on any of those list views is great, but can THIS (the Song Title or Album Artwork) be a home/now playing button? 

4. Let us CYCLE !  (This should be easy as well!)
It is GREAT that one can suppress and change the order of the list views!! It would be even better if those would be available not only through the tiny note icon on the now-playing-screen, but also by simply swiping left! This way, you could simply cycle by swiping: 
... <-> Artist <-> NOW PLAYING <-> current Playlist <-> [Folder] <-> [...] <-> Album <-> Artist <-> Now Playing <-> ... 

This would be especially useful with (2) scroll positions remembered!

5. The option to use Album Artist Tags instead of Artist Tags is a good idea, but not useful right now because it suppresses ALL Artists that do not show up in Album Artist tags. So, if, like mostly the case, an album isn't tagged with album artist tags on top of artist tags, it won't show up at all. Please fix! (by automatically using the Artist Tag for any Album without  Album Artist Tags. This way compilations can be kept together and don't clutter the artist list, yet you don't loose all those single-artist-albums that aren't double-tagged)

6. Seeing ALBUM ART  Thumbnails in Album list view would be great! 
(It would also nicely set apart full albums from those orphaned single tracks everyone has in between)
Being able to use COVER FLOW on landscape rotation of the Album List view would be awesome of course. Am I asking too much?

I'll go ahead and donate something now! :-)
title: [whishlist] User Interface suggestions

body:
The main changes in my mergable branch relate to #249 and touches on #30. I'm sure this wasn't quite where you were going with this, but I've added, primarily for my own use, some quick access to the zeroconf/bonjour/avahi activity. I find this a fairly quick way of operating multiple mpd servers from MPDroid. Even without storing or simultaneously using multiple connection settings, switching is quick and easy enough to provide a nice stopgap.

I use a script that I currently call mpd-enslaver to synchronise playlists and play states between mpd servers, and have another branch with functions particular to that setup. Those probably aren't suitable for general use, however, as the server setup is quite convoluted.
title: Zeroconf and filesystem browser

body:
Hello,

I had a problem with cover art not showing in mpdroid. I had the option "Download local cover art" enabled and all the parameters set correctly. Checking the logfiles of my apache server (for the covers) and found it wanted to get the covers with the slash between the artist name and the album encoded with "%2F".

As a solution I had to set the option "AllowEncodedSlashes On" (or OnDemand?) in /etc/apache2/sites-available/default.

My problem is solved with this. Since I could not find this using google I wrote this issue so the next guy (or girl!) will.

Rolf
title: No local cover art was not shown (apache on debian)

body:
This pull req currently includes all the commits from #220. **Please don't merge until after #220!** I'll rebase the commits in here after that is merged.

Adds an option to display album artwork as tiles in the library, instead of in a list.

Changes:
* Display the amount of disk space used by album art in the cache fb7b720
* Fixed an exception in LastFMCover that I saw many times 1c8c497
* Refactored the AlbumDataBinder code so it's reusable 4bf783f cab003a
* Based on that, I refactored all places that listen for onCoverDownloaded events e8abde2
* 43e9e03 has the album artwork grid stuff shown here:

![Screen shot](https://gist.github.com/mafrosis/5500867/raw/c9962c7fe13d337a70ef913adbd3cd8d5c116e3a/Screenshot_2013-05-02-18-05-21.jpg)

**Notes:**

* Album artwork is now stored against both the album name, and the artist/album name. This obviously means storing more data, but seemed the sensible short-term option.
* In the case where we have two albums with the same title, unfortunately which ever is viewed first will have its album artwork cached against that name. This is obviously crap, but it is a feature of how MPD's API returns albums by album name only. (Albums with the same name already have their tracks mixed together when listing songs.)
* Album artwork will always be loaded from the cache and subsequently only be downloaded when connected to wifi.
* Switching the setting on requires cover caching to also be enabled to save on overall bandwidth usage.
* The feature is also noted experimental in settings :)

**Next steps:**

* Modifying CoverAsyncHelper to use AsyncTask and a thread pool to help loading many artworks concurrently.
title: Album grid (part two)

body:
This is a set of refactors which were required for some further stuff I'll open in a separate pull request. Since this pull req constitutes some *not insubstantial* changes, I thought it best to get this accepted first.

**Nothing in this pull req changes the existing functionality of MPDroid.** See #220 for the changes.

I've been testing this for about two weeks - I'm confident I haven't broken much ;)

* The biggest change is in 910172c where I removed the inheritance from FragmentListActivity, so that the fragments in the library can display something other than a list. To help understand why I did this, see the following screen shot:

![Screen shot](https://gist.github.com/mafrosis/5500867/raw/c9962c7fe13d337a70ef913adbd3cd8d5c116e3a/Screenshot_2013-05-02-18-05-21.jpg)

* The SearchActivity changes in ad2e640 are required as a result of 910172c.
* 3f93c01 401400f & dcf6563 are all efficiency refactors. (There are many places throughout MPDroid where we can apply this kind of cleanup.)
title: Fragment refactors (part one)

body:
I don't particularly want my music stream from MPD to be accessible to the world (especially since that might criminalize me given that I'd be distributing copyrighted music) so I've set up Apache to use MPD's httpd stream (available just to localhost) reverse proxied and made available with HTTP Basic authentication to the internet at large. In case that sounds good to anyone else, the mpd.conf bit looks like

```
audio_output {
	type		"httpd"
	name		"Mono HTTP Stream q3"
	encoder		"vorbis"
	port		"6731"
	quality		"3.0"
	format		"44100:16:1"
	bind_to_address		"localhost"
}
audio_output {
	type		"httpd"
	name		"Stereo HTTP Stream q3"
	encoder		"vorbis"
	port		"6732"
	quality		"3.0"
	format		"44100:16:2"
	bind_to_address		"localhost"
}
```
(and another one for a slightly higher quality stream)

Then in my Apache config I have (in the default host)

```
	ProxyRequests off
	<Location /mpd/>
		AuthType Basic
		AuthName "MPD streams"
		AuthUserFile /var/www/.htpasswords
		Require valid-user
	</Location>
	ProxyPass /mpd/monoq3.ogg http://localhost:6731
	ProxyPassReverse /mpd/monoq3.ogg http://localhost:6731
	ProxyPass /mpd/stereoq3.ogg http://localhost:6732
	ProxyPassReverse /mpd/stereoq3.ogg http://localhost:6732
```

That works: I can listen to that from anywhere with for instance `mplayer -user tremby -passwd abc123 http://example.com/mpd/monoq3.ogg`

But MPDroid doesn't like it, since it is getting 401 unauthorized responses which presumably it doesn't understand and just ignores, retrying.

It'd be great if options for HTTP Basic auth username and password could be added.

I'd also love there to be multiple configurable streams to choose from (like in this case here, I just want mono when playing through the speaker but stereo as soon as I plug in headphones), but I guess that's a separate feature request.
title: Support HTTP Basic auth on http streaming

I'm using your nice application to stream music to my smartphone, and controlling MPD via my tablet. But after working some time, smartphone loses connection to MPD server 
![Uploading screenshot-20130420-155245.png . . .]()

I think it is caused by smartphone switching to standby mode after display disabling or by WiFi disabling. It can by easily solved by http://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/PowerManager.WakeLock.html or http://developer.android.com/reference/android/net/wifi/WifiManager.WifiLock.html . You can just acquire lock when streaming is on and release it when streaming is off, so device will be waked up, until streaming will be stopped manually.
title: Streaming stopped after device goes into standby mode

Issue #199 - I've added this feature for myself, submitting a pull request in case you find this useful!

This creates an (ALL) option at the top of the FileSystem library type.  Long pressing it will allow you to add all songs to the current/specified playlist.  It will only appear at the root directory level and not in any subdirectories.  It will not appear in any other library types.

I've also added a `getId()` method to the `Item` class, so that the (ALL) behavior can be implemented in subdirectories or other library types (album, artist, etc.)

![Screenshot from 2013-03-24 19:44:19](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/746276/295848/5126699a-94bb-11e2-9042-1a2e78fd1f90.png)

My music has unicode title names, and this makes it so that the local cover art fails. In fact instead of showing the proper characters they get mangled. An example is detailed below:

The file in question is:

東方/[Silver Forest]/2011.08.13 [SFNC-0030] Vermillion Summer [C80]/cover.jpg

From the Android device using mpdroid (non-working):

"GET //??/[Silver%20Forest]/2011.08.13%20[SFNC-0030]%20Vermillion%20Summer%20[C80]/cover.png HTTP/1.1"

From a web browser (working):

"GET /%e6%9d%b1%e6%96%b9/%5bSilver%20Forest%5d/2011.08.13%20%5bSFNC-0030%5d%20Vermillion%20Summer%20%5bC80%5d/cover.jpg HTTP/1.1" 

As you can clearly see the path is getting mangled and therefore the file returns a 404 error to the android device. I'm not familiar with android development, but I guess it's your standard "at some stage some ascii only function is used instead of a unicode one" problem. All other places I've seen have no issue showing unicode.

Thanks a bunch.
title: Local Cover Art fails with Unicode Names

Here it is :)

Basicaly the idea is, when waiting for the server reply,  to release the lock switched on by the call to a synchronized method. The bugfix is mainly done by [this method](https://github.com/jcsaaddupuy/dmix/blob/jmpdcomm/JMPDComm/src/org/a0z/mpd/MPDConnection.java#L220)
- Added a socket read/write timeout in MPDConnection which will throw SocketTimeoutException and no longer lock the mpdconnection instance
- Removed the expectAnswer boolean (added in [153](https://github.com/abarisain/dmix/pull/153 ))
and the call to mpd close on mpdIdle connection before closing  the socket.

I also created a specific class for all MPD command and removed them from the class MPD.
title: Read write deadlock bugfix

I'm using IPv6 on my home network. The MPD server's host name has both an A and AAAA record in DNS. When a DNS query for a host returns both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, it is normal behavior that the IPv6 address is selected. When I enter the server's host name into MPDroid, it fails to connect because MPDroid doesn't support IPv6 connections.

If I enter the IPv4 address of the same server into MPDroid's settings, it can successfully connect.

It would be nice if MPDroid was able to connect to the MPD server (Mopidy in my case) using IPv6. It's probably just a matter of how the socket for the server connection is created.
title: IPv6 support

body:
MPDroid uses two connection channels. One for "idle", which allows the app to get updates about the current MPD status, and another for listing songs/sending playlist changes/etc ...

Mopidy (MPD does not do that) has a 30 second timeout on non idle connections, which makes MPDroid loose connection, triggering a "Connecting ..." popup.

However, due to MPDroid's somewhat really buggy core, it sometimes hangs forever and needs a forcequit.

MPDroid needs to keep the connection alive or find a way not to show this popup, or anything ...
Mopidy could remove their timeout, but the MPD protocol specification says that clients should be able to reconnect (only the "idle" mode is guaranteed not to timeout). If MPD ever changes, MPDroid will break, so it is something that needs to be fixed here.
title: Server connection dropped with Mopidy

body:
Hi,

I wanted to be able to build the project without using Eclipse at all (if someone wants a new version, they just want to generate the apk).

I cloned the project and generated what is needed, and it works. Here is the procedure.

First, get the target id associated to android-13 (android 3.2, the target of the project):
    android list target | grep android-13

For me, it's 6.
Then, in MPDroid folder, execute :
    android update project -p . -n MPDroid -t 6
(replace 6 by the id you get)

It should generate several files.

Your local.properties should reference the path of your SDK:
    sdk.dir=/your/path/to/the/sdk
This file must *NOT* be checked into GIT, as it contains information specific to your local configuration.

Because of your Eclipse-project dependencies on other projects (JmDNS, JMPDComm, LastFM-java), it does not work out-of-the-box.
The perfect way (for using only ant) would be to have one build.xml per-project and a root build.xml which call them and copy generated files (jar) as dependencies of other projects.
But as a workaround, we can just create a file named MPDroid/ant.properties containing:
    source.dir=src:../JmDNS/src:../JMPDComm/src:../LastFM-java/src

At this point, you should be able to generate a debug apk, for MPDroid directory :
    $ ant debug
(generated in bin/MPDroid-debug.apk)

For being able to generate a release APK directly, with:
    $ ant release
you should add your keystore and alias in your ant.properties file
    key.store=/home/user/.android/my.keystore
    key.alias=myalias

For better performances and smaller apk, you can enable proguard (included in Android SDK): http://developer.android.com/guide/developing/tools/proguard.html
This is very simple, your "android update project" generated a proguard-project.txt, just reference it in your project.properties, adding the following line:
    proguard.config=${sdk.dir}/tools/proguard/proguard-android.txt:proguard-project.txt

Enabling proguard, I get a final APK of 576K instead of 697K.

All these new files must be checked into GIT (except local.properties).


Please find attached 2 patches containing the changes made by applying this procedure.
- build-tools.patch
- enable-proguard.patch
title: Project build by Ant

body:
edit: solved, see below

Hi

I get the following error when trying to connect MPDroid to MPD:

"Connection to MPD-Server failed! Check if the Server is runnning and reachable. (Transport endpoint is not connected)"

I installed MPDroid on an HTC Desire. MPD is running on ubuntustudio and is working correctly when using Gnome Music Player Client locally.
It is listening on port 6600:
netstat -an | grep "LISTEN "
gives:
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:631           0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN     
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:4025            0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN     
tcp6       0      0 ::1:631                 :::*                    LISTEN     
tcp6       0      0 :::6600                 :::*                    LISTEN     

The phone is connected via wlan to the network. It receives an IP from the router (in the same subnet as the ubuntu computer). I can access internet, so the network seems to be working correctly.

In MPDroid config I use the ubuntu computer's IP and port 6600.
In mpd.conf I have

bind_to_address		"any"

I can also enter the phone's IP, id does not change anything.

What am I doing wrong, can somebody please help me?


Ok, it was a firewall issue. The command 

sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -d 0/0 -s 0/0 --dport 6600 -j ACCEPT

solved the problem.
MPDroid could connect immediately afterwards.

This is a really great program! Many thanks to the author.
title: MPDroid Connection Failed

Kind of says it all in the title. The problem is cause by the MPD protocol enclosing names in ", so names/titles with quotes in (that are not escaped) cause MPD not to find the desired name

"mytrack 12" mix" get truncated to "mytrack 12"

Regards

Phil

body:
My MPD server streams to an icecast server where the IP address, port, and URL are all custom, so the "Streaming Port" is inadequate. Further, I saw your commit allowing to also edit the IP address; this is still inadequate because you don't provide the chance to give the mount name.

The full path of the URL for the stream for me is something like http://example.com:12345/stream.mp3

where "example.com" is different from the IP/domain name of the MPD server, "12345" is different from the MPD port, and "/stream.mp3" is a required URL component that cannot currently be entered with mpdroid at all because the URL suffix is hard-coded as "/" in StreamingService.java, line 243. This behavior will be inadequate for anyone who uses an Icecast server, because it requires you to define mount names like that. The document root doesn't lead anywhere.

I cooked up a patch in case you're interested, and it basically touches the same things as your commit that adds the "Stream Address" setting. But instead of adding a setting, I simply replaced the streamingPort setting with the streamURL setting. The streamURL setting is a user-defined String that is meant to contain a well-formed HTTP URL to the stream. The software is capable of streaming from an arbitrary HTTP URL that yields an audio stream in a supported format, so I don't see why this won't work. I tested my code on an API 8 device, Motorola Droid 2, and it works fine. Let me know if you're interested, though the patch is quite trivial (replace streamingPort with streamURL, and change data type from int to String; remove the Integer.parseInt in MPDApplication.java, edit strings.xml, etc.)
title: Enter Full Stream URL

body: Some stuff needs to be cached. The iPhone client, MPoD goes as far as caching the whole library. With the recent performance boosts I don't think that it is THAT necessary anymore, but caching the last.fm covers could be really nice. There's a support for filesystem cache in the last.fm library, I think we should try to use it.
title: Caching

body:
The streaming feature seems to support only mp3 and doesn't warn the user when encountering an unsupported format (ogg, in this case) and only says it is buffering.
If I am not mistaken, in distributions like Debian, mpd is not compiled with mp3 streaming support, so I think you should put a warning or explain somewhere which format is supported.

Other than that, great app. The streaming feature is what is missing every mpd client.
Keep up the good work.
title: stream format support

body:
Many parts of the program are NOT backgrounded. (As in, almost every context menu and the update() function of the main activity) Since mpdroid needs to work over 3G (which pmix didn't care about), backgrounding needs to be setup (with "Loading ..." popups or not).
I think that it implies wrapping a lot of stuff into AsyncHelpers
title: Backgrounding
